doc.description:
Half ORM half DB management, the simplest class for data queries.
 *
Hello world!

tags.author: Thomas Nabet <thomas.nabet@gmail.com>
tags.todo: Check for the tables and column names legality in _treat_arguments

name: bbn\Db

isEngineSupported.name: isEngineSupported
isEngineSupported.summary: Says if the given database engine is supported or not

getEngineIcon.name: getEngineIcon
getEngineIcon.summary: Returns the icon (CSS class from nerd fonts) for the given db engine

createDatabaseSqlite.name: createDatabaseSqlite

getLogLine.name: getLogLine
getLogLine.summary: Returns a string with the given text in the middle of a "line" of logs.

__construct.name: __construct

getEngine.name: getEngine
getEngine.summary: Returns the engine used by the current connection.

getHost.name: getHost
getHost.summary: Returns the host of the current connection.

getCurrent.name: getCurrent
getCurrent.summary: Returns the current database selected by the current connection.

isAggregateFunction.name: isAggregateFunction
isAggregateFunction.summary: Returns true if the column name is an aggregate function

__toString.name: __toString
__toString.summary: Makes that echoing the connection shows its engin and host.

replaceTableInConditions.name: replaceTableInConditions

retrieveQuery.name: retrieveQuery
retrieveQuery.summary: Retrieves a query array based on its hash.

retrieveCfg.name: retrieveCfg
retrieveCfg.summary: Retrieves a configuration array based on its hash.

treatConditions.name: treatConditions

extractFields.name: extractFields

filterFilters.name: filterFilters
filterFilters.summary: Retrieve an array of specific filters among the existing ones.

getValuesDesc.name: getValuesDesc

arrangeConditions.name: arrangeConditions

reprocessCfg.name: reprocessCfg

processCfg.name: processCfg

removeVirtual.name: removeVirtual

error.name: error
error.summary: Set an error and acts appropriately based oon the error mode

check.name: check
check.summary: Checks if the database is ready to process a query.

clearCache.name: clearCache
clearCache.summary: Deletes a specific item from the cache.

addStatement.name: addStatement
addStatement.summary: Return an object with all the properties of the statement and where it is carried out.

setTrigger.name: setTrigger
setTrigger.summary: Apply a function each time the methods $kind are used

getFieldsList.name: getFieldsList

getForeignKeys.name: getForeignKeys
getForeignKeys.summary: Return an array with tables and fields related to the searched foreign key.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: The database name if different from the current one

hasIdIncrement.name: hasIdIncrement
hasIdIncrement.summary: Return true if in the table there are fields with auto-increment.

modelize.name: modelize
modelize.summary: Return the table's structure as an indexed array.

description_parts.content:
X::dump($db->modelize("table_users"));
// (array) [keys] => Array ( [PRIMARY] => Array ( [columns] => Array ( [0] => userid [1] => userdataid ) [ref_db] => [ref_table] => [ref_column] => [unique] => 1 )     [table_users_userId_userdataId_info] => Array ( [columns] => Array ( [0] => userid [1] => userdataid [2] => info ) [ref_db] => [ref_table] => [ref_column] =>     [unique] => 0 ) ) [cols] => Array ( [userid] => Array ( [0] => PRIMARY [1] => table_users_userId_userdataId_info ) [userdataid] => Array ( [0] => PRIMARY [1] => table_users_userId_userdataId_info ) [info] => Array ( [0] => table_users_userId_userdataId_info ) ) [fields] => Array ( [userid] => Array ( [position] => 1 [null] => 0 [key] => PRI [default] => [extra] => [signed] => 1 [maxlength] => 11 [type] => int ) [userdataid] => Array ( [position] => 2 [null] => 0 [key] => PRI [default] => [extra] => [signed] => 1 [maxlength] => 11 [type] => int ) [info] => Array ( [position] => 3 [null] => 1 [key] => [default] => NULL [extra] => [signed] => 0 [maxlength] => 200 [type] => varchar ) )

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: If set to true will force the modelization to reperform even if the cache exists

fmodelize.name: fmodelize

findReferences.name: findReferences

findRelations.name: findRelations

getPrimary.name: getPrimary
getPrimary.summary: Return primary keys of a table as a numeric array.

getUniquePrimary.name: getUniquePrimary
getUniquePrimary.summary: Return the unique primary key of the given table.

getUniqueKeys.name: getUniqueKeys
getUniqueKeys.summary: Return the unique keys of a table as a numeric array.

escapeValue.name: escapeValue
escapeValue.summary: Return a string with quotes and percent escaped.

description_parts.content:
X::dump($db->escapeValue("My father's job is interesting");
// (string) My  father\'s  job  is  interesting

setLastInsertId.name: setLastInsertId
setLastInsertId.summary: Changes the value of last_insert_id (used by history).

parseQuery.name: parseQuery
parseQuery.summary: Parses a SQL query and return an array.

last.name: last
last.summary: Return the last query for this connection.

getLastCfg.name: getLastCfg
getLastCfg.summary: Return the last config for this connection.

lastId.name: lastId

flush.name: flush
flush.summary: Deletes all the queries recorded and returns their (ex) number.

rawQuery.name: rawQuery
rawQuery.summary: Executes the original PDO query function

newId.name: newId
newId.summary: Generate a new casual id based on the max number of characters of id's column structure in the given table

rselectRandom.name: rselectRandom

selectRandom.name: selectRandom

randomValue.name: randomValue
randomValue.summary: Returns a random value fitting the requested column's type

getOne.name: getOne
getOne.summary: Executes the given query with given vars, and extracts the first cell's result.

description_parts.content:
X::dump($db->getOne("SELECT name FROM table_users WHERE id>?", 138));
// (string) John

getVar.name: getVar
getVar.summary: Execute the given query with given vars, and extract the first cell's result.

description_parts.content:
X::dump($db->getVar("SELECT telephone FROM table_users WHERE id>?", 1));
// (int) 123554154

getKeyVal.name: getKeyVal
getKeyVal.summary: Return an array indexed on the first field of the request.

description_parts.content: The value will be an array if the request has more than two fields. *

getColArray.name: getColArray
getColArray.summary: Return an array with the values of single field resulting from the query.

select.name: select
select.summary: Returns the first row resulting from the query as an object.

selectAll.name: selectAll
selectAll.summary: Return table's rows resulting from the query as an array of objects.

iselect.name: iselect
iselect.summary: Return the first row resulting from the query as a numeric array.

iselectAll.name: iselectAll
iselectAll.summary: Return the searched rows as an array of numeric arrays.

rselect.name: rselect
rselect.summary: Return the first row resulting from the query as an indexed array.

rselectAll.name: rselectAll
rselectAll.summary: Return table's rows as an array of indexed arrays.

selectOne.name: selectOne

selectUnion.name: selectUnion

count.name: count
count.summary: Return the number of records in the table corresponding to the $where condition (non mandatory).

selectAllByKeys.name: selectAllByKeys
selectAllByKeys.summary: Return an array indexed on the first field of the request.
selectAllByKeys.description:
The value will be an array if the request has more than two fields.
Return the same value as "get_key_val".
   *
```php
X::dump($db->selectAllByKeys("table_users", ["name","id","surname"], [["id", ">", "1"]], ["id" => "ASC"]);
/*
(array)[
       "John" => [
         "surname" => "Brown",
         "id" => 3
         ],
       "Michael" => [
         "surname" => "Smith",
         "id" => 4
       ]
     ]
```

description_parts.content: The value will be an array if the request has more than two fields. Return the same value as "get_key_val". *

stat.name: stat
stat.summary: Return an array with the count of values corresponding to the where conditions.

getFieldValues.name: getFieldValues
getFieldValues.summary: Return the unique values of a column of a table as a numeric indexed array.

countFieldValues.name: countFieldValues
countFieldValues.summary: Return a count of identical values in a field as array, Reporting a structure type 'num' - 'val'.

getColumnValues.name: getColumnValues
getColumnValues.summary: Return a numeric indexed array with the values of the unique column ($field) from the selected $table

getValuesCount.name: getValuesCount
getValuesCount.summary: Return a string with the sql query to count equal values in a field of the table.
getValuesCount.description:
*
```php
X::dump($db->getValuesCount('table_users','name',['surname','=','smith']));
/*
(string)
  SELECT COUNT(*) AS num, `name` AS val FROM `db_example`.`table_users`
    GROUP BY `name`
    ORDER BY `name`
```

description_parts.content:
*

X::dump($db->getValuesCount('table_users','name',['surname','=','smith']));
/*
(string)
  SELECT COUNT(*) AS num, `name` AS val FROM `db_example`.`table_users`
    GROUP BY `name`
    ORDER BY `name`

insert.name: insert

arguments.name: values
arguments.description: If true, controls if the row is already existing and ignores it.

insertUpdate.name: insertUpdate
insertUpdate.summary: If not exist inserts row(s) in a table, else update.

update.name: update

arguments.name: where
arguments.description: If IGNORE should be added to the statement

updateIgnore.name: updateIgnore
updateIgnore.summary: If exist updates row(s) in a table, else ignore.

deleteIgnore.name: deleteIgnore
deleteIgnore.summary: If exist deletess row(s) in a table, else ignore.

insertIgnore.name: insertIgnore
insertIgnore.summary: If not exist inserts row(s) in a table, else ignore.

fetch.name: fetch
fetch.summary: Return an indexed array with the first result of the query or false if there are no results.

fetchAll.name: fetchAll
fetchAll.summary: Return an array of indexed array with all results of the query or false if there are no results.

fetchColumn.name: fetchColumn
fetchColumn.summary: Transposition of the original fetchColumn method, but with the query included. Return an arra or false if no result

fetchObject.name: fetchObject
fetchObject.summary: Return an array with stdClass object or false if no result.

query.name: query
query.summary: Executes a writing statement and return the number of affected rows or return a query object for the reading * statement

tfn.name: tfn

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

tsn.name: tsn

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

cfn.name: cfn

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

csn.name: csn

arguments.name: col
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

postCreation.name: postCreation
postCreation.summary: Actions to do once the PDO object has been created

change.name: change
change.summary: Changes the database used to the given one.

escape.name: escape
escape.summary: Escapes names with the appropriate quotes (db, tables, columns, keys...)

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

isTableFullName.name: isTableFullName
isTableFullName.summary: Returns true if the string corresponds to the tipology of a table full name.

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped

arguments.name: table
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped

arguments.name: col
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

getDatabases.name: getDatabases
getDatabases.summary: Return databases' names as an array.

getTables.name: getTables
getTables.summary: Return tables' names of a database as an array.

getColumns.name: getColumns
getColumns.summary: Return colums' structure of a table as an array indexed with the fields names.
getColumns.description:
*
```php
X::dump($db->getColumns('table_users'));
/* (array)[
           "id" => [
             "position" => 1,
             "null" => 0,
             "key" => "PRI",
             "default" => null,
             "extra" => "auto_increment",
             "signed" => 0,
             "maxlength" => "8",
             "type" => "int",
           ],
          "name" => [
             "position" => 2,
             "null" => 0,
             "key" => null,
             "default" => null,
             "extra" => "",
             "signed" => 0,
             "maxlength" => "30",
             "type" => "varchar",
           ],
           "surname" => [
             "position" => 3,
             "null" => 0,
             "key" => null,
             "default" => null,
             "extra" => "",
             "signed" => 0,
             "maxlength" => "30",
             "type" => "varchar",
           ],
           "address" => [
             "position" => 4,
             "null" => 0,
             "key" => "UNI",
             "default" => null,
             "extra" => "",
             "signed" => 0,
             "maxlength" => "30",
             "type" => "varchar",
           ],
         ]
```

description_parts.content:
X::dump($db->getColumns('table_users'));
/* (array)[
           "id" => [
             "position" => 1,
             "null" => 0,
             "key" => "PRI",
             "default" => null,
             "extra" => "auto_increment",
             "signed" => 0,
             "maxlength" => "8",
             "type" => "int",
           ],
          "name" => [

             "extra" => "",

           ],

         ]

getKeys.name: getKeys
getKeys.summary: Return the table's keys as an array indexed with the fields names.

getSelect.name: getSelect
getSelect.summary: Return SQL code for row(s) SELECT.

getInsert.name: getInsert
getInsert.summary: Returns the SQL code for an INSERT statement.

getUpdate.name: getUpdate
getUpdate.summary: Returns the SQL code for an UPDATE statement.

getDelete.name: getDelete
getDelete.summary: Returns the SQL code for a DELETE statement.

getJoin.name: getJoin
getJoin.summary: Returns a string with the JOIN part of the query if there is, empty otherwise

getGroupBy.name: getGroupBy
getGroupBy.summary: Returns a string with the GROUP BY part of the query if there is, empty otherwise

getHaving.name: getHaving
getHaving.summary: Returns a string with the HAVING part of the query if there is, empty otherwise

getOrder.name: getOrder
getOrder.summary: Get a string starting with ORDER BY with corresponding parameters to $order.

getLimit.name: getLimit
getLimit.summary: Get a string starting with LIMIT with corresponding parameters to $limit.

getTableComment.name: getTableComment
getTableComment.summary: Returns the comment (or an empty string if none) for a given table.

getCreate.name: getCreate
getCreate.summary: Return SQL code for table creation.
getCreate.description:
*
```php
X::dump($db->getCreate("table_users"));
/*
(string)
   CREATE TABLE `table_users` (
     `userid` int(11) NOT NULL,
     `userdataid` int(11) NOT NULL,
     `info` char(200) DEFAULT NULL,
      PRIMARY KEY (`userid`,`userdataid`),
      KEY `table_users_userId_userdataId_info` (`userid`,`userdataid`,`info`)
   ) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8
   *
```

description_parts.content:
*

X::dump($db->getCreate("table_users"));
/*
(string)
   CREATE TABLE `table_users` (
     `userid` int(11) NOT NULL,
     `userdataid` int(11) NOT NULL,
     `info` char(200) DEFAULT NULL,
      PRIMARY KEY (`userid`,`userdataid`),
      KEY `table_users_userId_userdataId_info` (`userid`,`userdataid`,`info`)
   ) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8
   *

createIndex.name: createIndex
createIndex.summary: Creates an index on one or more column(s) of the table

deleteIndex.name: deleteIndex
deleteIndex.summary: Deletes index on a column of the table.

createUser.name: createUser
createUser.summary: Creates an user for a specific db.

getUsers.name: getUsers
getUsers.summary: Return an array including privileges of a specific db_user or all db_users.

getRow.name: getRow
getRow.summary: Return the first row resulting from the query as an array indexed with the fields' name.

getRows.name: getRows
getRows.summary: Return an array that includes indexed arrays for every row resultant from the query.

getIrow.name: getIrow
getIrow.summary: Return a row as a numeric indexed array.

getIrows.name: getIrows
getIrows.summary: Return an array of numeric indexed rows.

getByColumns.name: getByColumns
getByColumns.summary: Return an array indexed on the searched field's in which there are all the values of the column.

getObj.name: getObj
getObj.summary: Return the first row resulting from the query as an object (similar to {@link get_object()}).

getObject.name: getObject
getObject.summary: Return the first row resulting from the query as an object.

getObjects.name: getObjects
getObjects.summary: Return an array of stdClass objects.

getQueryValues.name: getQueryValues

renameTable.name: renameTable
renameTable.summary: Renames the given table to the new given name.

getInstance.name: getInstance
getInstance.summary: Returns the instance of the singleton or null.

retrieverExists.name: retrieverExists
retrieverExists.summary: Returns true if an instance as been initiated.

summary: Half ORM half DB management, the simplest class for data queries.
